title: Shawl, 19th century
medium:
Medium: wool
Technique: 2/2 twill double interlocked tapestry with stem, running and couching embroidery stitches
description: Square patchwork shawl with a square center containing four squares that are red, green, violet and blue. Each is isolated by black bands. The primary emphasis is the border with is a continuous arrangement of typical Kashmiri boteh forms. A narrow and fringed patchwork border is at each end.

tombstone.epitaph:
Shawl, 19th century.Medium: wool
Technique: 2/2 twill double interlocked tapestry with stem, running and couching embroidery stitches. 1969-140-1.
